page.title: 05Jobs at the Brickworks.
page.content:
My dad, Micheal Leach, is a forklift driver.He takes the bricks off the kiln car and loads them onto the forklift.They are then taken to cool off.Terry Leach, my uncle,and also my Uncle Bill both work on the forklift as well.My grandfather, Bert Leach, greases the machinery and makes sure nothing goes wrong. Elizabeth Leach, his wife, is a secretary sorting out all the orders for bricks and for trips around Westbrick. My other grandad, Wilfred Bartlett, makes wooden boxes for specially shaped bricks. These boxes must be very accurate so that the bricks come out the right shape and size.
By Kevin Leach , (12 years)
